reviews.text: Good points:
reviews.title: Fresh hotel with some negatives

reviews.text: +Friendly staff that are proactive to help (although they aren't empowered to solve all problems).
reviews.title: Pleasantly surprised

reviews.text: +Big rooms with bright colours and good amenities.
reviews.title: From the perspective of a regular Hilton patron...

reviews.text: +Breakfast, although limited, features freshly cut fruit
reviews.title: Probably will not stay here again

reviews.text: Bad points
reviews.title: Not At Standard of Most Hyatt Places

reviews.text: I have mixed feelings on my stay at this hotel.
Location-Good if you have a car. Not within walking distance of mall/restaurants, but easy access, good parking. Did not have any concerns about safety.
reviews.title: Great Room!

reviews.text: Checkin-in- Very helpful. Great lobby. We had been placed in a room that had a connecting door to a family with a lot of screaming going on, went right back down and they moved us to a new room with ease. Purchased a bottle of water for $2.45 one evening and only one person working and very tied up with another client. Luckily had exact change and left it. Their desserts & baked goods look very good, but didn't try them.
reviews.title: Okay but not up to par to other Hyatt Place

reviews.text: Price-good value for the $ (except the water, no other vending than front desk)
reviews.title: Nice place

reviews.text: Breakfast-Simple, continental. I didn't have high expectations here, and I was fine with the choices. The hotel was very full, and it was crowded.
reviews.title: Nice hotel

reviews.text: Was travelling with a group tour so not sure how much $ the rooms were but had suites & they were nice! Carpet had a few burn marks on it but everything seemed clean & lobby was nice! Staff treated us great & they have a shuttle to nearby restaurants. Shopping within walking distance! If you want a great, higher end meal eat at Joey D's!
reviews.title: Nice suites

reviews.text: The only thing the place has going for it is that it looks trendy. When we arrived, the hotel had sold out of our requested/reserved room type. Since we had booked the room several weeks ago I didn't anticipate a problem, but the hotel claimed they couldn't do anything about it since we didn't book through them but used a third-party travel website. The best the manager could do was offer a sincere apology and a complementary meal. The travel website I used handled it well when I called them, but we still had to make the best of it. We didn't sleep well because we didn't have enough beds, the air conditioner was very loud, breakfast was just so-so. Customer service is not their strength here. Once breakfast is over, you have to pay for the coffee. If you're only interested in a minimalist approach to customer service, this will probably be good for you. If you're looking for a real hotel experience, skip this. It wasn't worth it.
reviews.title: A disappointment

reviews.text: Although the hotel appears to be kept well, it is in need of better maintenance and some updating. The carpet in my room was dirty. The mirror on the closet was cracked. There was no telephone at the desk only at the side of the bed. The air conditioner was working but was very loud and rattled if the fan came on. The walls are extremely thin and you can hear clearly anything that happens in any adjoining room or in the hallway. Overall the decor is drab and is in need of an intense cleaning and updating. This includes their meeting facilities. The staff was friendly and tried to be helpful but the facility is what it is and can be improved. There are more attractive hotels close by with similar pricing but better facilities.
reviews.title: Needs Updating

reviews.text: The family and I took a trip to Atlanta to visit other family and friends, and to do some shopping and sight seeing. With that said, we surely weren't going to spend a lot of time in any hotel, but the time that we did spend in the Hyatt was perfect.
reviews.title: Perfect for the Occassion

reviews.text: Great Breakfast each morning. The staff was very patient and kind.
reviews.title: I would try another place

reviews.text: Stayed here for a weekend anniversary getaway to Atlanta. We wanted to stay away from downtown and use Marta to get around. The hotel is close to two Marta stations so the location was perfect for us. I requested an early check-in and a room away from elevators, both of which I received.
reviews.title: Good bang for your buck

reviews.text: Pros:
reviews.title: A little Cramped

reviews.text: - The price ($74 for a weekend night)
reviews.title: OK

reviews.text: - Convenient location for staying in North ATL
reviews.title: Anniversary to remember

reviews.text: - Big TV (42" HD)
reviews.title: Great hotel for business and family travel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have never stayed in a Hyatt before and only got this one because it was about the last place with rooms available on a busy holiday weekend. Every area was clean and sleek, staff very friendly and helpful, and the room large and comfortable for a relaxing long weekend. King size bed was very comfy and the room met my "most important" criteria: 1. very dark at night; 2. plenty of surfaces to set out my stuff (including a cool area of cubbies that provided nice storage without taking up floor space); 3, great lighting and seating for reading. The lights by the bed even adjusted to different levels of brightness which was a real treat. The long corner couch (with ottoman) was comfy and made room for my very tall husband to lie down and me sit comfortably. Full desk and frig offered us all we could need. Breakfast was healthy and filling, including interesting breakfast sandwiches like something you'd get at a nice sandwich shop, along with Belgian waffles and various fresh fruit and many other options. The best treat was looking for milk to purchase in the lobby late our first night and the staff giving us two generous size cups of skim milk on the house--our favorite nightcap! The hotel was in a lovely area with dozens of excellent restaurants and an outstanding mall, the 2nd largest in the Southeast. We had no trouble getting to other locations around the city such as the zoo, downtown, or the Emory area. We will definitely consider staying at Hyatts again in the future.
reviews.title: pleasant surprise

reviews.text: First visit to this property. Took a king room on the 6th floor. Very large room with tons of space, beautiful sitting area with sofa and large ottoman. There is also a work desk, a little kitchen area with fridge, bar sink, coffee set up plus a nice counter vanity area for the bath. Only 2 small complaints. The tub is very narrow and slippery. The other complaint is that the room was a little musty smelling. The lobby area was very warm for August and did not seem air conditioned at all. This was a little uncomfortable even for the very cold natured people in our group. With that said the breakfast buffet (complimentary) and coffee bar is excellent. Choices ranged from bagels, toast, French toast, hot breakfast sandwiches, fruit, cottage cheese, yogurt, cereal. The coffees were nice and the you could also choose teas. The lobby sitting area was great for breakfast, opening up the laptop and working before we left each day. The free Internet worked great in the lobby and my room. FYI ice is only on alternate floors. I just made sure each evening to scoot down one floor to fill my bucket for the evening. The little soaps and shampoo were a nice honey scent. The towels were good quality. I would stay again as this is very close to the office, dining and shopping.
reviews.title: Excellent large rooms and great breakfast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Took the weekend to relax and unwind. The staff was friendly, the breakfast was tasty and the room was gorgeous. We were able to take in some sites and do a little shopping. And one of the staff recommended Uncle Julio's to us. It was great.
reviews.title: A Stay-cation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was traveling with a group of friends and our goals were to sightsee and enjoy the nightlife in ATL. I have stayed at the Hyatt Place in a couple different cities and I thought this one was okay. I thought the king suite was on the small side but the room was clean and the bed was comfy. The free breakfast was good and well stocked. The front desk staff were friendly and helpful. Just a fyi if you looking to sightsee and experience the nightlife...you may want to stay in the downtown area, I found that everywhere we wanted to visit was at least a 15-20 minute drive, depending on traffic. But, this hotel was in a very nice area, close to restaurants and a mall.
reviews.title: "OKAY"
We did not want to come home
reviews.text: I really enjoyed my hotel stay everything was clean and nice. Breakfast was the best because it was buffet and when I came down it was clean. At first I thought everyone were clean when they were getting food but actually the hotel was cleaning every few minutes and keeping the food stocked. But it was a great location: close to downtown by far enough away to pay cheaper prices.

This is the perfect hotel to make as your headquarters in the North Atlanta area. It is close to LOTS of shopping and restaurants, as well as the Marta station. Beds are very comfortable and the sitting area is a very nice feature. We LOVED the TV! The free breakfast was just what we needed to start the day. It is an easy 10 minute drive down to Buckhead and you can get to downtown on the Subway in about 15 or 20 minutes. I definitely will stay here again!
reviews.title: comfort is key!

reviews.text: Booked through hotwire and was so happy to stay here. Room was spacious and bed was very comfortable. Stayed 2 nights on business. Loved the couch in the room and the tv was huge. Breakfast was filling and staff was super friendly. I would recommend this hotel to anyone traveling.
reviews.title: What a great hotel, I love Hyatt Place.

reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel for a night. This was our first time to use self check-in machine. Our room has a setting area, 42"flat screen TV, granite countertop, and bar area. Restaurants and supermarket were only less than a miles away, very convenience.
reviews.title: HUGH room and good price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed here after completing a Name Your Own Price deal on Priceline. The lobby is modern and clean with ample seating. Originally, we were assigned two separate rooms for the duration of our stay, but the staff was very helpful and saw to it that we did not have to change rooms. The continental breakfast was very fresh and tasty. It included lots of fruit, yogurt, english muffins, bagels, oatmeal, toast, and cereal. Starbucks coffee was also served.
reviews.title: Friendly staff, great location

reviews.text: The room was pretty nice, with a separate seating area and huge flatscreen TV. I especially liked the layout of the room (separate shower/toilet area, sink area, another sink and refridgerator area, seating area, and bed). There were, however, a few small things that could have been improved (broken latch on toilet seat & small hole in ceiling above sink). Had we paid the asking price for this hotel, I might have disappointed that everything wasn't in perfect condition, but with the great deal we got on Priceline, I could not complain.
reviews.title: It's ok if you're desperate

reviews.text: My company uses this hotel frequently and we have people staying pretty much every week of the year. I have had several stays since July 2012 and have never had any problems. The rooms are spacious and clean with lots of amenities. Last time I had refurbished room which was nice. Nice fresh carpeting and the bathroom had a full shower rather than a bath / shower. The morning breakfast is nice and there are lots of eating places within a few minutes drive of the hotel and the MARTA (Sandy Springs) is close by. Front desk staff have always been nice and efficient. I have never used the free Shuttle but colleagues have and liked the service.
reviews.title: Not had a bad stay

reviews.text: Colleagues have not always had such great luck. Several have complained that the walls are paper thin so rooms can be very noisy. Others have have mentioned musty smells. If you can ask for a refurbished room away from the elevators for the best chance of avoiding noise.
reviews.title: This property is shows the Hyatt Place brand in its best light!

reviews.text: Just checked out a few days ago, and this property is great. Rooms are newly 'refreshed', and the new linens and such are nice.
reviews.title: Location is great but front desk is a mess

reviews.text: The room was spotless, the staff warm and friendly.
reviews.title: Great Stay

reviews.text: The breakfast bar was great. Plentiful, nice variety...certainly ahead of the competition here.
reviews.title: Good choice

reviews.text: Stayed here after seeing Cirque at Atlantic Station. Great location took us about 10 mins to get here. New and clean. Comfortably sleeps us and our 4 children. 2 doubles and a pull out. Plus breakfast is included. Great deal!
reviews.title: Excellent Location, New, Clean

reviews.text: Stayed overnight for pleasure, traveling with child. Our 'double' room was a bed with a couch pull-out, but for one night I didn't complain. Same quality of staff, check-in, and room as other Hyatt Place locations, which is why I chose it. Free parking. Food was slightly better than from previous stays, with fresh fruit selections and hot breakfast sandwiches included - a nice plus. Our room was next to elevators, so would request a room away next time as there were some late night folks being a bit loud while waiting for the lift. Clean room, reasonably comfortable bed, hot shower. Will stay here again!
reviews.title: Consistent quality
Great Staff
reviews.text: Excellent location to IBM offices. Clean hotel. But what makes this a great stay is the staff. Very thoughtful and go out of their way to help.
Thank you kindly for making my stay enjoyable.
reviews.title: Very friendly and helpful staff, very comfortable.

reviews.text: Blessings to you all,
reviews.title: Excellent Choice for Business Travel
